title: Conditional expectation with regularization for missing data imputation. (arXiv:2302.00911v2 [stat.ML] UPDATED)
abstract: Missing data frequently occurs in datasets across various domains, such as medicine, sports, and finance. In many cases, to enable proper and reliable analyses of such data, the missing values are often imputed, and it is necessary that the method used has a low root mean square error (RMSE) between the imputed and the true values. In addition, for some critical applications, it is also often a requirement that the imputation method is scalable and the logic behind the imputation is explainable, which is especially difficult for complex methods that are, for example, based on deep learning. Based on these considerations, we propose a new algorithm named "conditional Distribution-based Imputation of Missing Values with Regularization" (DIMV). DIMV operates by determining the conditional distribution of a feature that has missing entries, using the information from the fully observed features as a basis. As will be illustrated via experiments in the paper, DIMV (i) gives a low RMSE for t

Title: Conditional expectation with regularization for missing data imputation. (arXiv:2302.00911v2 [stat.ML] UPDATED)
Abstract: Missing data frequently occurs in datasets across various domains, such as medicine, sports, and finance. In many cases, to enable proper and reliable analyses of such data, the missing values are often imputed, and it is necessary that the method used has a low root mean square error (RMSE) between the imputed and the true values. In addition, for some critical applications, it is also often a requirement that the imputation method is scalable and the logic behind the imputation is explainable, which is especially difficult for complex methods that are, for example, based on deep learning. Based on these considerations, we propose a new algorithm named "conditional Distribution-based Imputation of Missing Values with Regularization" (DIMV). DIMV operates by determining the conditional distribution of a feature that has missing entries, using the information from the fully observed features as a basis. As will be illustrated via experiments in the paper, DIMV (i) gives a low RMSE for t
translated_abstract: 缺失数据在医学、体育和金融等各个领域的数据集中经常发生。在许多情况下，为了能够对这些数据进行适当可靠的分析，通常需要对缺失值进行插补，并且所采用的方法需要使插补值与真实值之间的均方根误差(RMSE)较低。此外，在某些关键应用程序中，插补方法的可扩展性以及逻辑的可解释性也是必不可少的要求，这对于基于深度学习等复杂方法特别困难。基于这些考虑，我们提出了一种新算法，命名为"带正则化的基于条件分布的缺失值插补"(DIMV)。DIMV通过确定具有缺失条目的特征的条件分布，使用完全观察到的特征信息作为基础。正如本文所述，通过实验证明，DIMV(i)给出了一个低的RMSE
tldr: 本文提出了一种名为DIMV的新算法，它使用完全观察到的特征信息作为基础，确定具有缺失条目的特征的条件分布，能有效地插补缺失值并具有较低的RMSE。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a new algorithm named DIMV for missing data imputation, which determines the conditional distribution of a feature using the information from fully observed features as a basis, resulting in effective imputation and low RMSE.
